question_text: The chief of Russia’s Wagner Private Military Company staged a short- lived Mutiny against the country›s defense establishment, pushing Russia into an unprecedented internal security crisis. Wagner Group: y The Wagner Group also known as PMC Wagner is a Russian paramilitary organization, founded in 2014. y Essentially a network of contractors that supply soldiers for hire, the group isn’t registered anywhere and its source of funding remains unknown. y The organization’s owner and head is Yevgeny Prigozhin.a y Wagner at its peak had about 50,000 mercenary recruits many of them ex-prisoners - fighting in Ukraine. y The group has operated for years on battlefields in the Middle East, Africa and Latin America. y According to media reports, it provides its services to different governments often in exchange for access to gold and diamond mines....

In a recent meeting held in New Delhi, India and the four European countries that form the European Free Trade Association (EFTA) have expressed their willingness to resume their negotiations for a Trade and Economic Partnership Agreement (TEPA) that has been stalled since 2018. About EFTA: y It is an intergovernmental organization established in 1960 by the Stockholm Convention. y Objective: Promotes free trade and economic integration between its members within Europe and globally. y EFTA currently has 4 member countries: Iceland, Liechtenstein, Norway and Switzerland. y The EFTA countries have developed one of the largest networks of Free Trade Agreements (FTAs). These FTAs span over 60 countries and territories, including the European Union (EU). y In contrast to the EU, EFTA is not a customs union. This means that the individual EFTA States are free to set their own customs tariffs and arrange other foreign trade measures vis-à-vis the non-EFTA States....

y It consists of the Member States of the European Union (EU) and three countries of the European Free Trade Association (EFTA) (Iceland, Liechtenstein and Norway, excluding Switzerland). y The Agreement on the EEA entered into force on 1 January 1994. y It seeks to strengthen trade and economic relations between the member countries. y It is principally concerned with the four fundamental pillars of the internal market, namely: the free movement of goods, people, services and capital....

India has been elected to the highest statistical body of the United Nations for a four-year term beginning January 1, 2024. About UN Statistical Commission: y It was established in 1947(HQ: New York) and is the highest body of the global statistical system. y It brings together the Chief Statisticians from member states from around the world. y Functions: ⚪ It is the highest decision-making body for international statistical activities, responsible for setting statistical standards and the development of concepts and methods, including their implementation at the national and international levels. ⚪ The Statistical Commission oversees the work of the United Nations Statistics Division (UNSD), and it is a Functional Commission of the UN Economic and Social Council....

y Widely known as the world’s “Atoms for Peace and Development” organisation within the United Nations family, the IAEA is the international centre for cooperation in the nuclear field. y The IAEA was created in 1957 in response to the deep fears and expectations generated by the discoveries and diverse uses of nuclear technology. y The IAEA headquarter is in Vienna, Austria. y It is an independent international organisation that reports annually to the United Nation General Assembly. y When necessary, the IAEA also reports to the UN Security Council in regards to instances of members’ non-compliance with safeguards and security obligations....

The International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA), has released its annual data on illicit trafficking of nuclear and other radioactive material. The data shows that radioactive materials or contaminated devices are entering into the booming scraps recycling chain, posing a grave health hazard. What does the IAEA Data Suggest? y he IAEA’s Nuclear Security Plan was established to report incidents of illicit trafficking of nuclear and other radioactive material....

y The latest dataset shows that incidents of unauthorised disposal of radioactive sources slipping into scrap metal or waste recycling industries are increasing. ⚪ The occurrence of such incidents indicates deficiencies in the systems to control, secure and properly dispose of radioactive material. y The resulting contaminated metal, if used to manufacture household goods, could pose a potential health problem to unsuspecting consumers. ⚪ IAEA reported 146 incidents in 2022, which is an increase of nearly 38% over the 2021 figure....

y Convention on International Civil Aviation (also known as Chicago Convention), was signed on 7 December 1944 by 52 States. y CAO is an intergovernmental specialized agency associated with the United Nations (UN). y Headquarters: Montreal, Canada y ICAO came into being on 4 April 1947. y In October of the same year, ICAO became a specialized agency of the United Nations linked to the Economic and Social Council (ECOSOC)....

y It is a global market-based measure designed to offset international aviation CO2 emissions in order to stabilize the levels of such emissions. y Offsetting of CO2 emissions will be achieved through the acquisition and cancellation of emissions units from the global carbon market by aeroplane operators. y It does not apply to domestic aviation. Under it, aircraft operators will begin monitoring their emissions from international flights and begin acquiring offsets for their emissions growth....
topic_hint: Carbon Offsetting and Reduction Scheme for International Aviation (CORSIA)

question_text: About the UNSC Sanctions Committee y It was set up in 1999 to monitor the implementation and effects of embargoes or sanctions it has decided to impose against States as well as non-State entities or individual....

The Indian Navy has recently inked an agreement with Sagar Defence Engineering Pvt. Ltd for acquiring armed autonomous boat swarms under the ‘SPRINT’ initiative. y ‘SPRINT’ Scheme is an initiative to promote development of niche defence technologies by domestic companies. y The task of development of this technology is one of the 75 challenges that have been introduced by the Indian Navy under Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav last year. y To achieve ‘Aatmanirbharta’ in defence, Naval Innovation and Indigenisation Organisation (NIIO), in conjunction with the Defence Innovation Organisation (DIO), aims to induct at least 75 new indigenous technologies/products into the Indian Navy till august 2023. y This collaborative project is named SPRINT {Supporting Pole- Vaulting in R&D through Innovations for Defence Excellence (iDEX), NIIO and Technology Development Acceleration Cell (TDAC)}. y It was launched by Prime Minister in July, 2022. y It will transform the Navy from a ‘Buyer’s Navy’ to a ‘Builde...
y The Ministry of Defence had launched the NIIO in August 2020, to encourage innovation and indigenisation for self-reliance in the defence sector. y It is a 3-tiered organization:...

y Recently, Russia has announced to suspend its participation in the New START, the last remaining major military agreement with the United States. y The name START comes from the original “Strategic Arms Reduction Treaty”, known as START-I, which was signed between the US and the erstwhile USSR in 1991, and came into force in 1994. y START-I, which capped the numbers of nuclear warheads and intercontinental ballistic missiles (ICBMs) that each side could deploy at 6,000 and 1,600 respectively, lapsed in 2009, and was replaced first by the SORT, also known as the Treaty of Moscow), and then by the New START treaty. New START y The New START, the “Treaty between the United States of America and the Russian Federation on Measures for the Further Reduction and Limitation of Strategic Offensive Arms”, entered into force on 5th February 2011, and placed new verifiable limits on intercontinental-range nuclear weapons. y The two countries had to meet the treaty’s central limits on strategic o...

y India and the United States held the 13th Ministerial-level meeting of India – United States Trade Policy Forum (TPF) in Washington, DC. y The meeting has resulted in a smoother, friendlier, and trusted environment for businesses to expand their trade and investment between the two countries. About the India-US Trade Policy y TPF is a platform for continuous engagement between the two countries in the area of trade and to further bilateral trade and investment relations. y The Trade Policy Forum is a premier forum to resolve trade and investment issues between India and the US....

y Theme- ‘One Earth One Family One Future’. y It means ‘Vasudhaiva Kutumbakam’ (the whole earth is a family) written in Devanagari script. y The theme is drawn from the ancient Sanskrit text of the Maha Upanishad. y Guest countries- India has invited Bangladesh, Egypt, Mauritius, the Netherlands, Nigeria, Oman, Singapore, Spain and UAE as guest countries during its G20 presidency. y India achieved a unanimous “New Delhi Leaders’ Summit Declaration” on all developmental and geopolitical matters. y The declaration reflects India’s motto of “Sabka Saath, Sabka Vikas, Sabka Vishwas” –“Together with all, Development for all, Trust of all”, which resonates with the spirit of multilateralism and inclusiveness....

question_text: The 11th IBSA Trilateral Ministerial Commission meeting was held in New York in September 2023 on the sidelines of the 78th United Nations General Assembly session 2023. Key Takeaways: A joint statement issued after the meeting called for reform of the United Nations Security Council and greater representation of the developing countries of Asia, Africa and Latin America. About ISBA: y It is a Trilateral Dialogue Forum of India, Brazil and South Africa which was created in the year 2003. y The grouping was formalized under the name of the IBSA Dialogue Forum under the Brasilia Declaration. y Objective: Promoting ever closer coordination on global issues between the three large multicultural and multiracial democracies of Asia, South America and Africa, and contributing to enhancing trilateral India-Brazil-South Africa cooperation in sectoral areas....

Raisina Dialogue y The Raisina Dialogue is India’s flagship conference on geopolitics and geo-strategy with focus on the most challenging issues facing the global community. ⚪ It is organized by the Ministry of External Affairs in collaboration with Observer Research Foundation (ORF)....

Stockholm Agreement y The agreement was signed by warring parties in control of Yemen in 2018. y They committed to freeing conflict-related detainees y The agreement was brokered by UN and has three main components: ⚪ Hudaydah Agreement for ceasefire on the City of Hodeidah and Ports Hodeidah, Salif and Ras Isa, and other clauses like no military reinforcements in the city and strengthened UN presence. ⚪ Prisoner Exchange Agreement for the exchange of prisoners, detainees, missing persons, arbitrarily detained and forcibly disappeared persons, and those under house arrest. ⚪ Taiz Agreement for formation of a joint committee with participation from the civil society and the UN....

India made a voluntary contribution of US $150,000 to the UN Democracy Fund for the (UNDEF) year 2022–23. About UNDEF y UNDEF was created by UN Secretary-General Kofi A. Annan in 2005 as a UN General Trust Fund to support democratization efforts around the world. y It funds projects that empower civil society, promote human rights, and encourage participation of all groups in democratic processes. Functioning y An Advisory Board of UNDEF considers proposals, offers policy guidelines, and recommends funding proposals for approval by the Secretary General. India Membership y India, a founding member of UNDEF, is also a current member of the Advisory Board....

Global terrorism index ( 2023) y GTI covers global trends and patterns in terrorism. y It is released by Sydney-based Institute for Economics and Peace. Key findings y Afghanistan remains most impacted by terrorism for the fourth consecutive year, followed by Burkina Faso and Somalia. y India remained at 13th while Pakistan ranked at 6th....

India-Bangladesh inaugurated a cross-border energy pipeline known as India-Bangladesh Friendship Pipeline (IBFP). About the IBFP: y IBFP runs from Siliguri (India) to Parbatipur (Bangladesh), and its second cross-border energy pipeline between India and Bangladesh and second in South Asia. ⚪ In 2019, India-Nepal opened South Asia’s first cross-border oil pipeline i.e., Motihari (Bohar)-Amlekhgunj (Nepal) oil pipeline. ⚪ It has a capacity to transport 1 million Metric ton per annum (MMTPA) of High-Speed Diesel (HSD) to Bangladesh and therefore enhances energy cooperation between two countries....

India has deployed more than a quarter of a million troops over the years in as many as 49 UN Peacekeeping Missions. India was the first country to deploy an all-women contingent for the Formed Police Unit to the UN peacekeeping mission in Liberia. About UN Peacekeeping y Peacekeeping operations get their mandates from the UN Security Council. y Their troops and police are contributed by the Member States. y They are guided by three basic principles: Consent of the parties; Impartiality and Non-use of force except in self-defense and defense of the mandate. y India in collaboration with the UN launched UNITE Aware Platform, a situational awareness software programme that will utilize modern surveillance technology for real time threat assessments to peacekeepers....

The International Maritime Organization (IMO) has adopted a new Maritime mandatory International Organization (IMO) Code of Safety for Ships Carrying Industrial Personnel. y Code will enter into force on 1 July 2024 and enables cargo ships and high- speed cargo craft to transport and accommodate industrial personnel working offshore. About IMO y It is a specialized agency of the UNO with 174 member states. y It is responsible for measures to improve the safety and security of international shipping and to prevent pollution from ships. y Headquarters: London...

India’s Minister of External Affairs reiterated that full implementation of the 13A is “critical” Amendment for achieving reconciliation with the minority Tamil community. About the 13th Amendment y It is an outcome of the Indo-Lanka Accord of July 1987 in an attempt to resolve the ethnic conflict and civil war. ⚪ 13A will facilitate unity among all the communities in Sri Lanka so that they could live as one. y It provides for the devolution of Lanka’s power to the Tamil community by creation of Provincial Councils. ⚪ This assured a power-sharing arrangement to enable all nine provinces in the country, including Sinhala majority areas, to self-govern. y Subjects such as education, health, agriculture, housing, land and police are devolved to the provincial administrations. y Present status: Due to restrictions on financial powers and overriding powers given to the President, the provincial administrations have not made much headway....

India has been assigned an area of about 75,000 sq km in the Central Indian Ocean Basin (CIOB) for PMN (Polymetallic Nodules) exploration. y Ministry of Earth Sciences signed PMN exploration extension contract with International Seabed Authority Authority (ISA) y Contract for the same was initially signed in 2002 for a period of 15 years. It has been extended twice for a 5 years period, during 2017 and 2022. About International Seabed Authority y It is an autonomous international organization established under the 1982 United Nations Convention on the Law of the Sea (UNCLOS). y Mandate: Ensure effective protection of the marine environment from harmful effects that may arise from deep-seabed-related activities. y Headquarters: Kingston, Jamaica y Its primary function is to regulate the exploration of poly-metallic nodules. About Polymetallic nodules y PMN refers to small potato-like rounded accretions composed of minerals such as manganese, nickel, cobalt, copper and iron hydroxide y T...

y The Work Plan was approved at the 3rd ASEAN Digital Ministers meeting. y The work plan includes capacity building and knowledge sharing in emerging areas in the field of Information and Communication Technologies such as: ⚪ Artificial Intelligence in Cyber Security, ⚪ Application of IoT & AI in Next Generation Smart City & Society 5.0, ⚪ Sustainable Data and Transport Network for Future: Standards and Applications, ⚪ 5G technologies for IoT and future trends, ⚪ Role of ICT in implementation of Digital Health and Security protection, etc. ⚪ It will strengthen collaboration between India and ASEAN in ICT...

y Economic and commercial cooperation ⚪ Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement (CEPA) ⚪ Japan is largest bilateral donor to India with investment in major infrastructure projects such as Delhi-Mumbai Industrial Corridor y Military cooperation ⚪ Joint exercises such as Shinyuu Maitri, Dharma Guardian, sahyog Kaijin, etc. y Bilateral cooperation in Indo-Pacific ⚪ Integrated Indo-Pacific strategy, Asia-Africa Growth Corridor y Other agreements such as Supply-Chain Resilience Initiative y India and Japan are working with Brazil and Germany for permanent membership of G4 of UNSC...

y Indo-Pacific Economic Framework for Prosperity (IPEF) is an initiative of USA with member countries namely: ⚪ Australia, Brunei Darussalam, Fiji India, Indonesia, Japan, the Republic of Korea, Malaysia, New Zealand, Philippines, Singapore, Thailand, and Vietnam. y Aim: The IPEF partners aim to contribute to cooperation, stability, prosperity, development, and peace within the region y It offers tangible benefits that fuel economic activity and investment, promote sustainable and inclusive economic growth, and benefit workers and consumers across the region y The framework will advance resilience, sustainability, inclusiveness, economic growth, fairness, and competitiveness for our economies....

question_text: y Five-nation “informal mechanism” to support Pacific islands and boost diplomatic and economic ties in the region. y It is an initiative of the USA and its allies to promote “effective and efficient cooperation” with the region’s small island nations. y Objective: Strengthening “prosperity, resilience, and security” in the Pacific through greater collaboration and closer cooperation. y Members:USA, New Zealand, Australia, UK and Japan...

In the News y India raised concern over not being part of the US-led Minerals Security Partnership (MSP). About MSP y MSP is an international partnership for a stable and diverse mineral supply chain. ⚪ Alliance will focus on supply chains of minerals such as Cobalt, Nickel, Lithium and also 17 “rare earth” minerals. y Objective: Ensure that critical minerals are produced, processed, and recycled to support the ability of countries to realize the full economic development benefit of their geological endowments. y Membership: 11-members i.e. Korea, US, Canada, Japan, Germany, UK, EU Commission, Finland, France, Australia, and Norway...

In the news y Talks on BTIA, the Free Trade Agreement (FTA) was resumed after a gap of about nine years since the earlier negotiations were left off in 2013 due to difference in the scope and expectations from the deal. ⚪ FTA involves agreements on trade, investments and Geographical Indications (GI). Other Agreements y Two other agreements under consideration: ⚪ Investment Protection Agreement (IPA): It is an agreement with reciprocal undertakings to promote and protect private investment made by nationals of the signatories in each others territories. ⚪ Geographical Indicators (GIs) Agreement: GI pact will establish a transparent and predictable regulatory environment, to facilitate trade of GI products. y Both sides have agreed to institute the EU-India Trade and Technology Council for strengthening economic and technological ties....

In the news y The US secretary of treasury has pushed for “friendshoring” to diversify trade away from countries that are present at geopolitical risk Friendshoring y Friendshoring (also known as allyshoring) is a deglobalization process that could result in more short-term supply surprises, price hikes, and less long-term growth. y It is a strategic practice of relocating supply chains to countries where the risk of disruption from political chaos is low. ⚪ The dependence on the countries considered a “threat” to the stability of the supply chains is slowly reduced. y For the US, Russia has long presented itself as a reliable energy partner, but in the Ukraine war, it has weaponized the gas against the people of Europe. y It’s an example of how malicious actors can use their market positions to try to gain geopolitical leverage or disrupt trade for their own gain. y Friend-shoring or ally-shoring has become a means for the US to influence firms to move their sourcing and manufacturing...

In the news y Chief Minister of Tamil Nadu urged for retrieval of the Katchateevu island from Sri Lanka recently. About Katchateevu island y Katchatheevu is a small uninhabited island in Palk Strait, which connects the Bay of Bengal to the Arabian Sea. y Katchatheevu island is of volcanic origin, formed in the 14th century. y It was jointly administered by India and Sri Lanka during British rule. Issue y The Kachchatheevu issue emerged when both the countries signed four Maritime Boundary Agreements between 1974-76, where in the island became part of Sri Lanka according to India-Sri Lanka Agreements...

In the news y India to take over the Chair of Global Partnership on AI (GPAI) from France. About GPAI y GPAI is an international and multistakeholder initiative to guide the responsible development and use of artificial intelligence consistent with human rights, fundamental freedoms, and shared democratic values. ⚪ The alliance aims to bridge the gap between theory and practice by supporting advanced research and applied activities on AI-related priorities ⚪ It was launched in 2020. y Membership: At present, GPAI has twenty-five member states including the US, the UK, EU, Australia, Canada, France, Germany, etc. y Headquarters: Its secretariat is hosted at the Organisation for Economic Cooperation and Development (OECD)....

y Voice of Global South summit called for a global agenda of ‘Respond, Recognize, Respect, and Reform’ to re-energise the world. ⚪ It was hosted by India virtually. y Objectives: Ensuring sustained momentum for effective implementation of G20 decisions, with a specific focus on the interests of developing countries. y Theme ⚪ Introductory session theme was ‘Together, for Everyone’s Growth, with Everyone’s Trust’, ⚪ Concluding session emphasized on ‘Global South: Together for One Future.’ y Key Outcomes: ⚪ 5 ‘Cs’ for Global South: India also called for 5 ‘Cs’ for the Global South: consultation, cooperation, communication, creativity and capacity building. ⚪ Call for Restraint Amid Israel-Hamas Conflict ⚪ Global South Center of Excellence ‘DAKSHIN’ inaugarated...

In the news y To deal with the economic impacts of Covid-19, Indonesia has announced DNV for (DNV) travellers, to attract more foreign tourists. ⚪ o DNV would allow remote workers to stay tax-free. Digital Nomad y Person who works remotely while traveling for leisure, especially when having no fixed, permanent address. They embrace a location-independent, technology-enabled lifestyle that allows them to travel and work remotely, anywhere in the Internet-connected world....

In the news y Fifth anniversary of the India-Vietnam Comprehensive Strategic Partnership was celebrated. y In the backdrop of the anniversary celebrations, the countries signed three memorandum of understanding in parliamentary cooperation, information technology and marine sciences. y Initiatives to boost relations ⚪ Swami Vivekananda Indian Cultural Centre (SVCC) was in Hanoi aimed at fostering closer links between peoples of both countries through cultural exchanges. ⚪ India has given Vietnam a $600 million line of credit for buying defense equipment from India. ⚪ Under the Mekong Ganga Cooperation (MGC) framework, Quick Impact Projects (QIPs) for development of community infrastructure being taken up by India in Vietnam....

y India and South Korea have signed several agreements for increased cooperation as below: ⚪ A Comprehensive Economic PArtnership Agreement (CEPA) signed in 2010 ⚪ Special Strategic Partnership with focus on defence cooperation in 2015 ⚪ Civil Nuclear Energy Cooperation Agreement was signed in 2011 y South Korea launched “Korea Plus” with the objective of facilitating South Korean investments in India. y 2+2 dialogue to synergise India’s “Act East Policy” with South Korea’s “New Southern Policy” y Historical ties: ⚪ Rabindranath Tagore composed “Lamp of the East” poem on Korea’s glorious past and promising bright future ⚪ Shared Kinship and Buddhist Connection...

In the news y Paris Club creditor nations are proposing a 10-year moratorium on Sri Lankan debt to resolve the Sri Lankan debt crisis. About Paris Club y Paris Club is an informal group of official creditors whose role is to find coordinated and sustainable solutions to the payment difficulties experienced by debtor countries. ⚪ It originated in 1956. y Membership: It is a group of 22 permanent members, including Australia, UK, USA, Japan etc. y India is not a member. It acts as an ad-hoc participant....

y Indian Ocean Rim Association (IORA) is an intergovernmental organisation established to promote economic cooperation and regional integration among countries bordering the Indian Ocean. y Membership: IORA is open to all sovereign states of the Indian Ocean Rim willing to subscribe to the principles and objectives of the Charter. y Objectives: ⚪ To promote sustainable growth and balanced development of the region and Member States. ⚪ To focus on those areas of economic co-operation which provide maximum opportunities for development, shared interest and mutual benefits. ⚪ To promote liberalization, remove impediments and lower barriers towards a freer and enhanced flow of goods, services, investment, and technology within the Indian Ocean Rim....

y The member countries issued a joint declaration to foster digital innovation and inclusion, digital skilling, and security in the digital economy. ⚪ Digital Public Infrastructure (DPI) should be secure and interoperable and foster inclusion, innovation and competition in a trustworthy way while respecting human rights and fundamental freedoms. ⚪ Reliable Digital Public Infrastructure on the global stage should bring a more efficient and inclusive public administration at the service of the citizens. y Three main work areas were discussed: ⚪ Digital Public Infrastructure for digital inclusion and innovation; ⚪ Building a safe, secure, and resilient digital economy; and ⚪ Digital skilling for building a global future ready workforce...

question_text: y “The Spirit of Camp David” is the first-ever trilateral summit between the leaders of the United States, Japan, and South Korea at Camp David in Maryland. ⚪ It refers to the friendly, informal agreement between nations y The Spirit of Camp David statement issued by the three leaders is a political agreement, rather than a legal one requiring signature, but it nevertheless is a powerful document. y It represents a major effort to establish precedent, create momentum, and set the course for trilateral security cooperation among the three countries....

The Economic Community of West African States (ECOWAS) y It is a regional political and economic union of fifteen countries located in West Africa. Also known as CEDEAO (in French) y It is a regional group headquartered in Abuja, Nigeria. It was established in 1975. y The Lagos Treaty laid the foundation with a mandate of promoting economic integration among its members. y Aim: Single common currency and create a single trading bloc in diverse areas of industry, transport, telecommunications, energy, financial issues, and social and cultural matters. ECOWAS and India: y India achieved observer status to ECOWAS in 2004. y Following that, India has been providing Line of Credit (LOCs) to bolster its Focus Africa program and assist in ECOWAS’ regional integration efforts. This has led to expanded opportunities for Indian companies to engage in sectors such as energy, telecom, and transportation in West Africa. Additionally, ECOWAS has thrown its support behind India’s pursuit of a seat in...

Recently the UK agreed to become the 1st European country to join the Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP). CPTPP: y It is a Free trade agreement (FTA) between Australia, Brunei Darussalam, Canada, Chile, Japan, Malaysia, Mexico, Peru, New Zealand, Singapore and Vietnam....

question_text: Recently, nine European countries during the 2nd North Sea summit have signed a declaration which aims at transforming the North Sea into a green power plant. About the North Sea Summit: y The summit was held in the city of Ostend ( Belgium ) y Participant countries: Belgium, Denmark, France, Germany, Ireland, Luxembourg, Netherlands Norway, and the United Kingdom y Objective: To make the North Sea the largest green energy centre in Europe by accelerating the deployment of offshore wind turbines. y Targets: The summit sets ambitious targets including the production of at least 120 gigawatts (GW) of offshore wind energy in the North Sea by 2030 y The first summit in 2022 had the Esbjerg Declaration which was held in Denmark. y In the Esbjerg Declaration the four Heads of State committed to jointly building 150 GW of offshore wind energy in the North Sea by 2050....

Sweden has recently joined the North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO), making it a 32 member military grouping. North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) y The Washington Treaty led to its formation in 1949 which resulted in a security alliance of 30 countries from North America and Europe. y Fundamental goal is to safeguard the Allies’ freedom and security by political and military means. y It focuses on collective defense where independent member states agree for mutual defense in case of any attack by an external party. y Article 5 of the Washington Treaty: Attack against one Ally is an attack against all. y Headquarter: Brussels, Belgium....

India’s National Security Adviser (NSA) recently took part in the sixth NSA meeting of the Colombo Security Conclave (CSC) held in Mauritius. y As China’s influence and presence in the Indian Ocean grows, India has sought to enhance security cooperation with the Indian Ocean island and littoral nations, through a new ‘minilateral’ group called the Colombo Security Conclave (CSC). Colombo Security Conclave (CSC) y It is held at the National Security Advisor (NSA)-level. y It was formed in 2011 as a trilateral maritime security grouping of India, Sri Lanka and the Maldives. y It welcomed Mauritius as a fourth member at the fifth meeting of national security advisers. y Bangladesh and Seychelles attended as observers and have been invited to join the group. FIve Pillars of the Grouping: y Maritime Safety and Security y Countering Terrorism and Radicalization y Combating Trafficking and Transnational Organized Crime y Cyber Security, Protection of Critical Infrastructure and Technology y H...

Introduced in 2021, Japan’s AETI (Asia Energy Transition Initiative) initially provided backing to the Association of SouthEast Asian Nations (ASEAN) in their efforts to reach net zero emissions. This assistance involved a commitment of USD 10 billion in financial aid dedicated to advancing renewable energy endeavors. y With a target of achieving net zero emissions by 2070, India has set an ambitious goal, while Japan has embarked on a more accelerated path, aiming to achieve net zero by 2050. y Both nations are actively embracing novel technologies and economic models to facilitate the reduction of emissions....

The Wassenaar Arrangement, comprising 41 participating states, serves as a multilateral export control regime (MECR) focused on overseeing exports of conventional arms and dual-use goods and technologies. y In 2013, the Wassenaar Arrangement broadened its framework by introducing a fresh category centered on “intrusion software.” y This category encompassed software capable of serving as “monitoring tools” or undermining “protective countermeasures” within cyberspace. y Furthermore, hardware and software designed for “information extraction” were incorporated into this newly restricted category. y The Wassenaar Arrangement has been established in order to contribute to regional and international security and stability, by promoting transparency and greater responsibility in transfers of conventional arms and dual-use goods and technologies, thus preventing destabilizing accumulations. Objective of Wassenaar Arrangement: Export Controls for Conventional Arms and Dual-Use Goods and Techn...

The treaty was signed in 1960, between India and Pakistan and mediated by the World Bank for sharing of the Indus water between the two nations. Objective: The treaty fixed and delimited the rights and obligations of both countries concerning the use of the waters of the Indus River system. Major Provisions for sharing of river water: y The water of the eastern rivers that is Sutlej, Beas, and Ravi (around 33 million acre feet (MAF)) annually — is allocated to India and is for unrestricted use. y The water of western rivers that is Indus, Jhelum, and Chenab (around 135 MAF) annually has been assigned mostly to Pakistan....
